moves.1. e4 e5 2. f4 exf4 3. Nf3: Here playing white on a King's knight gambit. It's a blitz game 5min+15.
moves.3... Nc6: Well, me too I like to open with this knight. Fischer said d6 was the best continuation, giving the oportunity to pin quickly the knight with Bg4.
moves.4. Bc4 h6: Thinking about to follow with g5, protecting the f pawn and threatening the king. I still prefer to do directly g5. When playing the king gambit, the tempo is so much important.
moves.5. O-O d6 6. d4 a6: Thinking to move out my bishop, but by doing so he is losing tempo.
moves.7... Nge7 8. e5: Well I was thinking about a way to move away my knight or my bishop to attack f7. If black exchange it will give me this oportunity + it will give me space on the e line.
moves.9. Be2: Getting away of the knight's reach.
moves.9... Be6 10. Nbd2: Thinking about to continue with c4.
moves.10... Nf5 11. Nb3: I like going to b3 with my knight it give most of the times some nice places to go.
moves.11... Qd7 12. Nc5: ? Well played too quickly here and forgot about the bishop. Rc1 would have been better I think.
moves.12... Bxc5 13. dxc5: Now Black got a passed pawn on the center and some of my pawns are pretty weak now.
moves.13... O-O-O 14. b4: ? Well the knight just need to take it.
moves.14... d4 15. b5 axb5 16. Bxb5 Ne3: Threatening my queen and my rook, no choice to take it.
moves.17. Bxe3 dxe3 18. Qe2: Qxd7, Rxd7, Bxc6, bxc6 would have gave me a nice position. But I didn't like that e pawn. Black was doing fine at this point.
moves.18... Bd5 19. Ba6:
!! This side of the field is completly unprotected and the b line is freed. I don't think there's a way for black to escape the mate at this point.

If bxa6, then Qxa6+ followed by Rb1#
moves.19... Bxf3 20. Bxb7+ Kxb7: If Kb8, then Qa6 then Qa8#.
moves.22... Rdb8 23. Qa4+ Na5 24. Qxa5#: Well it was a good game.
